intro: Hapalostephium spinulosum, commonly known as the spiny leaf grass, is a perennial grass species native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, spiny leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the Poaceae family. Hapalostephium spinulosum is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and tolerate harsh conditions.
